page.title: 02ECOLOGY-LAND E. OFFCHURCH.
page.content: The land{E. of Offchurch}is composed of rolling arable{farmland}with five small{woodlands, a canal, disused {railway and some ponds.}The landscape has changed in recent years, though still leafy, as many hedges have been uprooted, enlarging fields, for easier access by modern farming machinery. { Dutch Elm disease}has wiped out many elm trees and ponds have dried out as water is piped for irrigation. However{wildlife}has found havens in the disused railway, the canals and roadside verges, which are left uncut except on edges. Many farmers have replaced dead elms and are planting new woodland areas. One farm reservoir is being constructed. { Wild plants}seen include Horsetail, Ox_eye Daisy, Jack by the Hedge, White Campion, Black Medick , Red and White Clover, Cowslip, Plantain and Vetch.
